sponsor.partnerMessage: Ever wanted to get your beef directly from local ranchers in Arkansas? Well now you can! Eat Local Beef is bringing ranch-raised, Arkansas-bred beef straight to your table. They'll be taking orders until mid-October, so time is almost up. Go ahead and get your beef HERE.

posts.title: Spinning on the Street
posts.content:
If you’ve ever wanted to give the pottery wheel a spin, October is your opportunity. 

  • Street smarts: The Community Creative Center in Fayetteville is hosting ‘Pottery on the Patio’ the first four Saturdays in October at the Nadine Baum Studios on Spring Street. The series of events is completely free.
  • Art days: The center will be hosting mini lessons on the pottery wheel, providing a sidewalk chalk mural space along with plenty of opportunity for other crafts and activities. Music and food will be present too, so you might just have to make your way out. 

For more info click HERE.

posts.title: Jury's Out
posts.content:
Local commercial real estate in Northwest Arkansas is plowing through past records, and Walmart's new HQ is moving the needle. 

  • In the zone: In the first half of 2021, businesses absorbed more than 1m sq/ft of commercial real estate space, and almost 2/3 of the record value of building permits was issued to Walmart’s new HQ on J Street. 
  • Fill ’er up: Despite the move toward remote work environments due to the pandemic, the demand for retail and office space is keeping in step with the growth of the region. Additionally, users absorbing warehouses and industrial spaces caused the vacancy rate to fall “below 10% for the first time since 2017.” 

Read the full Talk Business & Politics article HERE.

posts.title: The Safest Way to Travel
posts.content:
The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) awarded 60 airports across the US a collective total of more than $431.8 million in grants. The Springdale Municipal Airport made the cut. 

  • Upgrade: The Springdale airport was chosen as a part of the 2021 Airport Improvement Program to receive $3.85m for an extended taxiway and the installation of taxiway lighting. 
  • Placement: An interactive map shows which airports in 31 states and Puerto Rico landed money for more safety, sustainability and accessibility. 

For the full FAA press release, click HERE.

posts.title: Life Is A Highway
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas Community College is rolling out a new trucking program with a, get this, truck driving simulator.

  • School funding: Arkansas Department of Higher Education awarded NWACC a Regional Workforce Grant of $288,700, making the new program possible. The course prepares new students to obtain a class A, B, or C license, and re-equips experienced drivers. 
  • Test drive: The program offers up to 40hrs with “in-cab simulation maneuvering, and evaluation and readiness assessments.” The simulator is an exact replica of a commercial vehicle that simulates its real life characteristics. 

Learn more about the program HERE.

posts.title: Kudos, NWA
posts.content:
Okay teachers, you must be doing something right.

  • Leaderboards: Northwest Arkansas schools topped all other Arkansas schools in Niche’s 2022 Best Schools in Arkansas List and took high honors in the US News’ ranking of US public Hugh schools. 
  • Top 5: Haas Hall Academy's Fayetteville and Bentonville locations are top 2 on both lists. Haas Hall At The Lane, Bentonville West and Bentonville High School take places 3, 4 and 5 in Niche's list.

Check out the US News list HERE and Niche's HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• H20: Here's a reminder to conserve water for those affected by the leak in Fayetteville.
  • Tiny home: You might want to build a backyard cottage after seeing these.
  • Closet thing to a safari: Have you ever wanted to stay the night with a lion?
  • Options: Bentonville is looking for input on some bike trail things.
  • Final days: It's the last week for BC10. Don't miss the closing talk.
  • Collaboration talk: We want to feature you - check out our advertising packages.
